head.title: POSTINGS: $15 Million Makeover Set for Retail Plaza; Citicorp Center Gets a Redesign

hedline.hl1: POSTINGS: $15 Million Makeover Set for Retail Plaza; Citicorp Center Gets a Redesign

block.p: The three-story, 70,000-square-foot retail plaza at Citicorp Center in Manhattan will undergo a $15 million renovation beginning in July.

Plaza renovations are to include providing street-level access to the shops, relocating escalators for improved traffic flow and installing new floors, ceilings, storefronts and lighting. The total selling space will remain the same but will be reconfigured.
The three-story, 70,000-square-foot retail plaza at Citicorp Center in Manhattan will undergo a $15 million renovation beginning in July.

Plaza renovations are to include providing street-level access to the shops, relocating escalators for improved traffic flow and installing new floors, ceilings, storefronts and lighting. The total selling space will remain the same but will be reconfigured.

To expand visibility and merchandising opportunities for the retail tenants at the 18-year-old center, Citibank will add exterior signs on all sides of the building and marquees at each of the three main retail entrances: at 54th Street and Third Avenue and on 53d and 54th Streets The renovation is expected to be completed by November 1996.
Barnes & Noble recently opened a 40,000-square-foot superstore and will be the anchor tenant in the renovated space, which will be called the Shops at Citicorp Center.
Occupying the remaining 30,000 square feet will be 14 specialty retailers, including a food market in the expanded atrium.

"We will create a distinctive urban retail environment in one of Manhattan's signature buildings," said Ilana A. Dreyer, project coordinator and vice president of Citibank. Victoria R. Dee, a spokeswoman for the project, said, "After 18 years, Citicorp decided it was time for a facelift."
Gwathmey Siegel and Associates of Manhattan is the principal architect.
